Text: I rejoiced with those who said to me, ”Let us go to the house of the LORD.“
Context: The speaker expresses joy at the prospect of going to worship at the temple.

Text: Our feet are standing in your gates, O Jerusalem.
Context: The statement reflects the speaker’s relief and satisfaction at having arrived in Jerusalem, ready to worship.

Text: Jerusalem is built as a city that is bound firmly together.
Context: The speaker observes the structural integrity and unity of Jerusalem.

Text: There the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to give thanks to the name of the LORD, according to the statute given to Israel.
Context: The verse reflects a positive religious duty, where the tribes of Israel go to Jerusalem to give thanks as prescribed by their laws.

Text: There stand the thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
Context: The speaker notes the presence of the thrones for judgment in Jerusalem, indicating the center of authority and justice.

Text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May those who love you be secure.”
Context: The speaker encourages prayer for the peace and security of Jerusalem.

Text: May there be peace within your walls and security within your citadels.
Context: Expresses a wish or blessing for peace and safety within the city of Jerusalem.

Text: For the sake of my brothers and friends, I will say, “Peace be within you.“
Context: A declaration of the speaker‘s concern for the well-being of their companions, wishing peace upon them.

Text: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your prosperity.
Context: The speaker expresses a commitment to seeking the prosperity of Jerusalem because of its significance as the location of the temple of God.
